summary: This is a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview transcript from September 22, 2021, with a former SigNet employee. The interview focuses on technical support issues with the video recording system (VMS) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York around August 8-10, 2019, the time of Jeffrey Epstein's death. The interviewee discusses failed hard drives, attempts to rebuild the RAID array, and the FBI's seizure of equipment during the rebuild process, which may have corrupted video data.

persons.name: Brianna Rose Burton
persons.context: Certified the transcript as accurate at the end of the document.

events.title: MCC Video System RAID Crash Reported
events.description: A SigNet service request was created for the Metropolitan Correctional Center after a RAID array crashed. The contact at MCC reported two bad drives in the Nice Vision Pro NVR unit.

events.title: FBI Seizes Video Recorder During Rebuild
events.description: The FBI arrived at MCC and confiscated the DVR-2 video recorder while replacement drives were being rebuilt, potentially corrupting the video database and preventing data recovery.

events.title: Possible Initial Drive Failure
events.description: The OIG investigators suggest the video system drives may have initially gone bad on this date, which could mean the system was not recording for a period before Epstein's death.

events.title: DOJ OIG Interview Conducted
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview with a former SigNet employee as part of its investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein and surrounding circumstances.

keyFacts: The interview is part of the DOJ OIG investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death and the surrounding circumstances.
A video recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center experienced a RAID array failure around August 8-10, 2019.
The FBI seized the DVR-2 recorder from MCC on August 10, 2019, while drives were being rebuilt, which may have corrupted the video database.
There is a question of whether the system was functional as early as July 29, 2019, which could impact the availability of video footage.
The interviewee, a former SigNet technical support employee, was on a weekend camping trip during the critical period and communicated remotely.
